name: beholder
content:

literary a person who sees or looks at someone or something: Perfection is in the eye of the beholder. To the dismay and sorrow of the beholders, the building burned to the ground. See
behold
More examplesFewer examplesThe look of such traditional Islamic dress commands instant respect from a modern beholder.The accuracy of his description lies in the mind of the beholder. Many of Rembrandt's greatest masterpieces imply the presence of a beholder in a particular place in front of the picture. Value is in the eye of the beholder and only expressed in monetary terms when the asset goes to auction.
